result.execSummary:
The defendant Freddy Lee Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Case #15 CF 033 -BUT- Consecutive to #13 CF 016 (Cts 1 & 8), 13 CF 074 (Cts 1 & 3) & 14 CF 0132

superMiscConds.notes: To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment/full time schooling or a combination of the two.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
  Defendant is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Freddy Lee Harris

records.addlTxt: to Terminate Wellness & Recovery Court Participant
02:24 PM Defendant Freddy Lee Harris not in court. Fails to appear BOW Nationwide

02:19 PM Defendant Freddy Lee Harris in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Got out of jail this morning cond jail time - done. 21 (1) days sob. App in at the Birch House. back in TC - Feels he knows what the minnimum requirements are. You are set up for success. Ct - Stay in contact w/ TC staff for min requirements. Focus on sob & TC. 3 SS contacts a week, min expect are show up and tell the truth. On the monitor.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 4, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

02:20 PM Defendant Freddy Lee Harris in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New use, last weekend. In order to be successful in life & TC needs to find a way to get out of the situation he is in. AODA orientation on the 7th. Had 2 sober contacts last week. Cond jail that was ordered is set to start this week. Ct - Rec of team is to begin cond jail time now instead of Sunday. 21 days of conditional jail. 20CF9 cond jail that was prev stayed commence immediately. If rel on the monitor ct expects compliance of trtmt ct. Before jail Mr. Harris can use the phone to resched his appt.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 26, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

02:44 PM Defendant Freddy Lee Harris in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF33 & 15CF46 - Ct has a conflict, has been provided a recusal waiver. Understands conflict, know, vol, intell, understands rec waiver. No promises or threats, ct finds Mr. Harris vol, know, intell, waiver in 15CF33, 15CF46. First appearance in TC. PW is done. Feels like he understands req of TC. Feels he can do the things to be successful, monitor is on, cerfew, to provide stability. 2 basic expectations, show up & tell the truth. Understands that. No trtmt plan right now. INIT at NL on Feb 7th. Min req 3 SS meetings a wk. On the monitor. Call in & tst as req, pos tst yest, used Monday night after got out of jail.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 5, 2020 at 01:30 pm.
